title: Factor out the greatest common term
text: What is the greatest common factor of all the terms in the expression $$16x^2+24x y-4x-6y$$?

title: Finding the GCF
text: What is the greatest common factor of $$16x^2$$, $$24x y$$, $$-4x$$ and $$-6y$$?

title: Group terms
text: Next, we will group the terms with similar factor together.

title: Group terms
text: In the expression $$8x^2+12x y-2x-3y$$, we will group $$8x^2$$ and $$12x y$$ together.

title: Factor by grouping
text: We will group $$-2x$$ with $$-3y$$ together and factor out $$-1$$. Then we get $$\left(-2x-3y\right)=-1\left(2x+3y\right)$$.

title: Finding the GCF
text: Put together the result of factoring by grouping , we yield $$8x^2+12x y-2x-3y=4x \left(2x+3y\right)-1\left(2x+3y\right)$$. What is the greatest common factor of $$4x \left(2x+3y\right)$$ and $$-1\left(2x+3y\right)$$?

title: Finding Values
text: $$4x \left(2x+3y\right)$$ and $$-1\left(2x+3y\right)$$ has the greatest common factor of $$2x+3y$$, so we can further factor $$4x \left(2x+3y\right)-1\left(2x+3y\right)$$ into (2*x+3*y)*(?). what is ?

title: Put together all factors
text: Based on the above steps, we get $$16x^2+24x y-4x-6y=2\left(8x^2+12x y-2x-3y\right)=2\left(2x+3y\right) \left(4x-1\right)$$

title: Final remark
text: Alternatively, you can also group (8*x**2 with -2*x), (12*x*y with -3*y) then do factoring by grouping. You should yield the same final answer. You can try it as exercise.
